questions.qn: You drive towards these people on the road. What should you do?

options: Look out for animals on the side of the road.
Take care and look out for pedestrians at a crossing.
Be careful because the road ahead is slippery
questions.qn: You see these zig-zag markings on the road in front of you. What do they mean?

options: Places where special speed limits apply.
Places where you can park.
Places where pedestrians have special rights.
questions.qn: These markings on the road indicate -

options: Slow down or stop to avoid hitting the person.
Slow down and sound your horn to hurry up the person.
Maintain your speed and swerve around the person.
questions.qn: You approach a person crossing the road. You should -

options: Stop and wait for the children until your lane is clear.
Slow down and drive through giving way to the children.
Slow down and stop until the supervisor takes down the sign.
questions.qn: You approach a crossing and see the scene in the picture. You should -

options: Stop and continue after the pedestrians have crossed.
Slow down and give way to pedestrians
Stop, wait for pedestrians to cross and for the green light to come on.
questions.qn: At a pedestrian crossing with traffic lights, when the lights change to red you should -

options: Slow down and sound the horn to warn the person to move back.
Give way to the person if there is any danger of colliding.
Maintain your speed so you do not hold up the traffic.
questions.qn: This person is standing on a pedestrian refuge. If he steps out onto your lane you should -

options: You must give way to pedestrians if there is a danger of a collision.
Pedestrians must cross the road only at marked crossings and intersections.
You do not have to give way to adults crossing at children's crossings.
questions.qn: Which of the following statements is correct?

options: You should ignore them and pay attention to the rear vision mirror.
You should reduce your speed by 5 km/h.
You should slow down and be more careful because they may move suddenly.
questions.qn: When you see children on or near the road -

options: Drive around them to keep the traffic moving
Slow down and take extra care because they may not see you until you are very close.
Sound your horn and keep going at the same speed so you do not hold up the traffic.
questions.qn: When you see older people on or near the road, you should -

options: Look more carefully for pedestrians because they are hard to see.
Keep your headlights on high beam all the time.
Always drive in the right hand lane so you can be away from pedestrians.
questions.qn: You must give way to pedestrians if there is a risk of hitting them. When driving in poor light, you should -

options: Take extra care, slow down and give way to the pedestrians.
Keep a look out for traffic coming in the opposite direction.
Slow down, but keep moving so you do not delay other drivers.
questions.qn: You drive up to a Light Rail vehicle that has just stopped at a tram stop. What is the most important thing you should do?

options: Only on marked foot crossings and traffic light pedestrian crossings.
Only on marked foot crossings.
At all times, if there is any danger of colliding with them, even if there is no marked crossing.
questions.qn: You must give way to pedestrians -

options: When they are crossing from your left only.
When they are crossing from your right only.
If there is any danger of a collision.
questions.qn: You must give way to pedestrians on a marked pedestrian crossing -

options: Slow down and be ready to make a safe stop.
Come to a complete stop before the crossing
Go faster, in case a pedestrian steps onto the crossing.
